connector.description: The azure-storage-queue component is used for storing and retrieving the messages to/from Azure Storage Queue using Azure SDK v12.

camel.sink.path.accountName.name: camel.sink.path.accountName
camel.sink.path.accountName.description: Azure account name to be used for authentication with azure queue services

camel.sink.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient
camel.sink.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient.description: Setting the autoDiscoverClient mechanism, if true, the component will look for a client instance in the registry automatically otherwise it will skip that checking.

camel.sink.endpoint.serviceClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.serviceClient
camel.sink.endpoint.serviceClient.description: Service client to a storage account to interact with the queue service. This client does not hold any state about a particular storage account but is instead a convenient way of sending off appropriate requests to the resource on the service. This client contains all the operations for interacting with a queue account in Azure Storage. Operations allowed by the client are creating, listing, and deleting queues, retrieving and updating properties of the account, and retrieving statistics of the account.

camel.sink.endpoint.createQueue.name: camel.sink.endpoint.createQueue
camel.sink.endpoint.createQueue.description: When is set to true, the queue will be automatically created when sending messages to the queue.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.operation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.operation
camel.sink.endpoint.operation.description: Queue service operation hint to the producer One of: [listQueues] [createQueue] [deleteQueue] [clearQueue] [sendMessage] [deleteMessage] [receiveMessages] [peekMessages] [updateMessage]

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.sink.endpoint.maxMessages.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maxMessages
camel.sink.endpoint.maxMessages.description: Maximum number of messages to get, if there are less messages exist in the queue than requested all the messages will be returned. If left empty only 1 message will be retrieved, the allowed range is 1 to 32 messages.

camel.sink.endpoint.messageId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.messageId
camel.sink.endpoint.messageId.description: The ID of the message to be deleted or updated.

camel.sink.endpoint.popReceipt.name: camel.sink.endpoint.popReceipt
camel.sink.endpoint.popReceipt.description: Unique identifier that must match for the message to be deleted or updated.

camel.sink.endpoint.timeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.timeout
camel.sink.endpoint.timeout.description: An optional timeout applied to the operation. If a response is not returned before the timeout concludes a RuntimeException will be thrown.

camel.sink.endpoint.timeToLive.name: camel.sink.endpoint.timeToLive
camel.sink.endpoint.timeToLive.description: How long the message will stay alive in the queue. If unset the value will default to 7 days, if -1 is passed the message will not expire. The time to live must be -1 or any positive number. The format should be in this form: PnDTnHnMn.nS., e.g: PT20.345S -- parses as 20.345 seconds, P2D -- parses as 2 days However, in case you are using EndpointDsl/ComponentDsl, you can do something like Duration.ofSeconds() since these Java APIs are typesafe.

camel.sink.endpoint.visibilityTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.visibilityTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.visibilityTimeout.description: The timeout period for how long the message is invisible in the queue. The timeout must be between 1 seconds and 7 days. The format should be in this form: PnDTnHnMn.nS., e.g: PT20.345S -- parses as 20.345 seconds, P2D -- parses as 2 days However, in case you are using EndpointDsl/ComponentDsl, you can do something like Duration.ofSeconds() since these Java APIs are typesafe.

camel.sink.endpoint.accessKey.name: camel.sink.endpoint.accessKey
camel.sink.endpoint.accessKey.description: Access key for the associated azure account name to be used for authentication with azure queue services

camel.sink.endpoint.credentials.name: camel.sink.endpoint.credentials
camel.sink.endpoint.credentials.description: StorageSharedKeyCredential can be injected to create the azure client, this holds the important authentication information

camel.component.azure-storage-queue.auto.name: camel.component.azure-storage-queue.autoDiscoverClient
camel.component.azure-storage-queue.auto.description: Setting the autoDiscoverClient mechanism, if true, the component will look for a client instance in the registry automatically otherwise it will skip that checking.

camel.component.azure-storage-queue.serv.name: camel.component.azure-storage-queue.serviceClient
camel.component.azure-storage-queue.serv.description: Service client to a storage account to interact with the queue service. This client does not hold any state about a particular storage account but is instead a convenient way of sending off appropriate requests to the resource on the service. This client contains all the operations for interacting with a queue account in Azure Storage. Operations allowed by the client are creating, listing, and deleting queues, retrieving and updating properties of the account, and retrieving statistics of the account.

camel.component.azure-storage-queue.crea.description: When is set to true, the queue will be automatically created when sending messages to the queue.

camel.component.azure-storage-queue.lazy.name: camel.component.azure-storage-queue.lazyStartProducer

camel.component.azure-storage-queue.auto.name: camel.component.azure-storage-queue.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.azure-storage-queue.auto.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.azure-storage-queue.maxM.name: camel.component.azure-storage-queue.maxMessages
camel.component.azure-storage-queue.maxM.description: Maximum number of messages to get, if there are less messages exist in the queue than requested all the messages will be returned. If left empty only 1 message will be retrieved, the allowed range is 1 to 32 messages.

camel.component.azure-storage-queue.mess.name: camel.component.azure-storage-queue.messageId
camel.component.azure-storage-queue.mess.description: The ID of the message to be deleted or updated.

camel.component.azure-storage-queue.popR.name: camel.component.azure-storage-queue.popReceipt
camel.component.azure-storage-queue.popR.description: Unique identifier that must match for the message to be deleted or updated.

camel.component.azure-storage-queue.acce.name: camel.component.azure-storage-queue.accessKey
camel.component.azure-storage-queue.acce.description: Access key for the associated azure account name to be used for authentication with azure queue services

camel.component.azure-storage-queue.cred.name: camel.component.azure-storage-queue.credentials
camel.component.azure-storage-queue.cred.description: StorageSharedKeyCredential can be injected to create the azure client, this holds the important authentication information
